Education

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”5/6″][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1688795716210{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”]Information for a New Owner

A brief summary of how a strata companies work, including how they are governed and their responsibilities as defined under the Strata Titles Act.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][mk_button url=”https://jdstrata.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/1.-welcome-pack-2023.pdf”]Download[/mk_button][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”5/6″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width=”5/6″][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1601421075669{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”]Default Schedule 1 & 2 Governance & Conduct By-Laws 

Default by-laws as per the Strata Titles Act 1985, regarding the management processes and behavioural rules which all owners and residents are obliged to abide by.

Note – these may be amended and repealed by strata companies over time by lodgement of additional by-laws on your strata plan. Such must be registered by application to Landgate and will appear by notification on the back page of your strata plan.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][mk_button url=”https://jdstrata.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/schedule-1-2-bylaws.pdf”]Download[/mk_button][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_separator][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1602371890879{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”]Disclaimer: The contents of this website do not constitute legal advice, are not intended to be a substitute for legal advice and should not be relied upon as such.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row]
